titleStmt.title: Letter to John Murray III
Letter to John Murray III, 29 April 1857
titleStmt.author: Livingstone, David, 1813-1873

publicationStmt.publisher: Wellcome Centre for the History of Medicine, UCL

sourceDesc.bibl: National Library of Scotland; MS. 42420, ff. 22r-24v

div.p:
I hear the
drawings are to
be taken down
at Stafford
House today. If you think
anything else
is needed Mr Wolf
ought to go before
they are removed.

My brother will
be in London
tomorrow evening.
He will I daresay
help me on a
little quicker I
believe he left
before my advice
about Â£30 came
to hand. Bbut it is
safe. Mr Binney
has made a good
many corrections
I shall embody
yours & his
together. He advised
a few sentences
on the change in
the feelings in my
history without
which many religious
people would set
the book down
as a merely intellectual
affair and that
I was not a religious
missionary at all.
I do so in 4 or 5
sentences & then
state that I will not
refer to the religious
feelings again not
to the evangelistic
labours to which
these impelled me
this will take away
the handle which
some might use
against it. Mr Binney
is pleased with it
and has also smoothed
some harsh sentences
which might
have given offence
to the sensitive.
Mr MacLehose of
Glasgow tells me he has
ordered 200 copies
so if it does not
sell well a heavy
sin will be at
my door!
I only wish it were
in a state for
selling at all.

I am to get a
view of Loando
from Captain
Need - & one of
a Baobab tree.
